variant.name: LongEnabled
variant.summary: ESB enabled duration was greater than 24 hours

variant.name: MediumEnabled
variant.summary: ESB enabled duration was between 1 hour and 24 hours

variant.name: NeverEnabled
variant.summary: There is no enabled duration because ESB wasn't manually enabled, or it has been longer than kEventMaxDurationDay days since the latest enabled event.

variant.name: ShortEnabled
variant.summary: ESB enabled duration was less than 1 hour

variant.name: DynamicUpdate
variant.summary: allowlist is generated through the component updater

variant.name: ResourceBundle
variant.summary: allowlist is generated through the local resource file
Applies both to consumer and enterprise checks.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AdvancedProtection.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the user has Advanced Protection enabled. Logged on startup when the enabled status changes. Can be logged multiple times for a user. In practice, this counts the number of Chrome startups with Advanced Protection enabled/disabled, rather than the actual user count.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.InstallerLoadFromDiskPbFileEmpty
histogram.summary: Records whether LoadFromDisk is attempting to read an empty pb file path. Logged whenever a component update or initial component load occurs for the RealTimeUrlChecksAllowlist component.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.IsInAllowlist.{AllowlistSource}Result
histogram.summary: Measures the result from performing an allowlist check when the {AllowlistSource}.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.IsInAllowlistElapsed
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to perform a real time url allowlist check.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.Populate.{AllowlistSource}Result
histogram.summary: Measures the outcome of populating the allowlist, when the {AllowlistSource}.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.Populate.{AllowlistSource}Size
histogram.summary: Measures the number of entries in the allowlist when the {AllowlistSource}. This metric is only recorded when populating the allowlist is successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.Populate.{AllowlistSource}Version
histogram.summary: Records the version of the allowlist when the {AllowlistSource}. This metric is only recorded when populating the allowlist is successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Android.RealTimeAllowlist.PopulateResourceFileElapsed
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to initialize a real time url allowlist.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AndroidTelemetry.ApkDownload.IncompleteReason
histogram.summary:
Records if the telemetry ping sent for APK download contained a full referrer chain, or if there was an error collecting the referrer chain. Logged each time a user opted into extended reporting downloads an APK file from a normal window on Android.
In M123, this was expanded to cover new kinds of failure leading to incomplete referrer chains.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-06-10 to 2023-08-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AndroidTelemetry.ApkDownload.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records whether a telemetry ping for APK download was sent, or if not, then why not. Logged each time a user downloads an APK file on Android. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-07-09 to 2023-08-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AndroidTelemetry.DownloadDirectlyTriggeredByIntent
histogram.summary: This records whether an APK download on Android was triggered by an intent. It is true even when the intent URL does server-side redirects to the final redirect URL. It is false however in the case of any client-side navigation, whether triggered by the user or not. This is logged on every suspicious APK download.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AsyncCheck.CommittedNavigationIdsSize
histogram.summary: The size of committed navigation ids stored in async check tracker. Logged each time DidFinishNavigation is called. The size keeps growing until the tab is closed, so this histogram helps us track if we should clean up the ids at some point.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AsyncCheck.HasPostCommitInterstitialSkipped
histogram.summary: Logs whether post commit interstitial is skipped when the check is completed and the result is don't proceed. Skipped means the check is completed before the navigation is finished, so the delay of the warning is minimum.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AsyncCheck.PendingCheckersSize
histogram.summary: The size of pending checkers stored in async check tracker. Logged each time TransferUrlChecker is called. This histogram helps us track if we leak any pending checker.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.AuthenticatedCookieResetEndpoint
histogram.summary: Records which endpoint changed the Safe Browsing cookie on an authenticated request. This is temporary logging to understand a performance change in https://crbug.com/40789301. This is logged every time the Safe Browsing cookie is changed on an authenticated request (once per network request, which is roughly once per navigation).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BlockingPage.ThreatType
histogram.summary: Logs the threat type that triggers the safe browsing blocking page. Logged each time a safe browsing blocking page is created. Note that this metric may be biased towards SB_THREAT_TYPE_SAFE, the default threat type.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.CheckerOnIOLifetime
histogram.summary: Records how long the BrowserURLLoaderThrottle::CheckerOnIO object exists for. Logged when the object destructs.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.IntervalBetweenStartAndProcess{ResponseType}
histogram.summary: Logs the interval between when the browser URL loader starts a request and when the browser URL loader is ready to process the response {ResponseType}. Logs each time the URL loader is ready to process the response and the start request function is previously called. During this interval, Safe Browsing checks are performed in parallel.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.IsAsyncCheckerTransferred
histogram.summary: Logs whether the async checker is transferred to the tracker when it can be transferred (sync check is completed and WillProcessResponse is called). If false, it means the async check is already completed. Only logged when async check is eligible for this URL loader.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.IsAsyncCheckFasterThanSyncCheck
histogram.summary: Logs true if the browser throttle's async checks completed faster than its sync checks, and false if the sync checks completed faster. Is not logged if there is a tie, which can happen for skipped checks. Logged when the browser throttle destructs. Only logged if async checks are eligible.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.IsCheckCompletedOnProcessResponse
histogram.summary:
Logs whether the Safe Browsing check is completed when the URL loader starts to process a response. If not, the URL loader will be deferred until the Safe Browsing check is completed. Logs each time the URL loader dispatches WillProcessResponse() and the Safe Browsing check doesn't block the URL.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.RequestDestination{RequestedSkippedOrChecked}
histogram.summary: Logs the request destination of the URL that is checked by the browser URL loader throttle, and whether the URL check was {RequestedSkippedOrChecked}. Logged each time WillStartRequest is called.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.TotalDelay2{ResponseType}
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between when the browser URL loader was deferred by Safe Browsing check and when the check is completed, for URL loaded {ResponseType}. This metric logs for each request, recording zero delay when the request is not deferred.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.TotalDelay2{UserCategory}
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between when the browser URL loader was deferred by Safe Browsing check and when the check is completed, for {UserCategory} URL check request. This metric logs for each request, recording zero delay when the request is not deferred.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.BrowserThrottle.WillProcessResponseCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that WillProcessResponse has been called for a single BrowserUrlLoaderThrottle. Logged each time WillProcessResponse is called.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckBrowseUrl.HasLocalMatch2
histogram.summary: Logs whether the Safe Browsing check via CheckBrowseUrl method matched any local hash prefixes. Logged each time the Safe Browsing reputation of a URL is checked using local blocklists.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.Action
histogram.summary: The action of URL check conducted by the Safe Browsing reputation lookup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.IsDocumentCheckPrefetch
histogram.summary: When a kDocument Safe Browsing URL check completes, logs whether the triggering load flags were net::LOAD_PREFETCH, which corresponds to rel=prefetch.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.Timeout
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the Safe Browsing reputation lookup timeout happens. Logged each time the Safe Browsing reputation of a URL is checked.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.TimeTaken.{CheckType}
histogram.summary: Records how long a Safe Browsing {CheckType} lookup took. Logged each time this kind of check completes, even if it times out. Note: This is the check that was initially attempted, even if it ended up falling back to a different type of check.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.UrlRealTimeWithBackgroundHashRealTimeMechanismTriggered
histogram.summary: Records whether a background hash real-time lookup was triggered within the UrlRealTimeMechanism for the real-time URL checks.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CheckUrl.UrlScheme
histogram.summary: Records the scheme of the URL whose Safe Browsing reputation is about to be checked. Logged before it has been determined whether or not the scheme is valid for Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.DownloadReportSize
histogram.summary: The size of a download client Safe Browsing report. Logged each time before a download report is sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.DownloadWarningActionSize
histogram.summary: Counts the length of the download_warning_actions field in a client Safe Browsing report. Logged each time the field is populated before a report is sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsAtFinish.Mainframe
histogram.summary: Records whether a threat details job is in progress before sending client safe browsing report for blocking page triggered by mainframe. If it is false, no report will be sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsForTab.SecurityInterstitial
histogram.summary: Records whether a threat details job is running on the current tab before sending security interstitial client safe browsing report. The job can be already deleted if the current tab is closed directly before the report is sent. Only log if the report should be sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.NetworkResult.{IsAccessTokenIncluded}
histogram.summary: Records the network result for a client safe browsing report request when the request {IsAccessTokenIncluded}.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.PersistDownloadReportResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of the call to persisting a download report on disk. Logged each time a download report needs to be persisted at shutdown.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.PersisterReadReportSuccessful
histogram.summary: Records whether reading a persisted report is successful. Logged each time a persisted report is found on startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.PersisterReportCountOnStartup
histogram.summary: Record the number of persisted report on startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.PersisterWriteResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of persisting a report on disk. Logged each time the persister write a report on disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.ReportType
histogram.summary: Records the report type of client safe browsing reports. Logged each time a report is about to be sent. It's not logged on failed cases (e.g. serialization error or empty report).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.RequestHasToken
histogram.summary: Records whether a sent client safe browsing report request contains a GAIA-tied OAuth2 token. This token is sent only for signed-in Enhanced Safe Browsing users.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.SendDownloadReportResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of the call to send a download report to the backend. Logged each time a download report needs to be sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ClientSidePhishingDetection.AllowlistMatchResult
histogram.summary: Logs the result of checking a URL against the local client-side phishing detection allowlist. This is triggered whenever the allowlist is checked, which applies both to client-side detection checks and password protection requests.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.CookieAgeHours2
histogram.summary: Records the age of the Safe Browsing cookie at profile startup or when a new profile is created, if there is a cookie present. Recorded for regular or incognito profiles.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Daily.BypassCountLast28Days.{UserState}.AllEvents
histogram.summary: Logs the total number of bypass events in the last 28 days. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles that are under {UserState} every 24 hours and at startup if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Daily.SecuritySensitiveCountLast28Days.{UserState}.AllEvents
histogram.summary: Logs the total number of security sensitive events in the last 28 days. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles that are under {UserState} every 24 hours and at startup if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast24Hours
histogram.summary: Records whether an ESB user has sent a Protego ping to the Safe Browsing consumer API servers within the last 24 hours. If a ping was sent since the last time this metric was logged, then this metric will report the type of that ping, otherwise it will report that none was sent. If the user has sent a ping of multiple types since the last time this metric was logged, then only the type of the most recent ping will be reported. This metric is logged at most once per day and only for users that have enhanced protection enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast24Hours2
histogram.summary: Similar to the metric SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast24Hours. Records whether an ESB user has sent a Protego ping to the Safe Browsing consumer API servers within the last 24 hours. If a ping was sent since the last time this metric was logged, then this metric will report the type of that ping, otherwise it will report that none was sent. Different from ProtegoRequestSentInLast24Hours, if the user has sent a ping of multiple types since the last time this metric was logged, kWithToken will be reported. This metric is logged at most once per day and only for users that have enhanced protection enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast7Days
histogram.summary: Similar to the SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast24Hours2 metric, records whether an ESB user has sent a Protego ping to the Safe Browsing consumer API servers within the last 7 days. If a ping was sent since the last time this metric was logged, then this metric will report the type of that ping, otherwise it will report that none was sent. Pings that had a token are logged preferrentially over pings without a token. This metric is logged at most once per day and only for users that have enhanced protection enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbDisabled.LastBypassEventType
histogram.summary: Records the last bypass event type before a user disables Enhanced Safe Browsing. Logged each time a user disables Enhanced Safe Browsing. Logged at most three times a week.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbDisabled.LastEnabledInterval
histogram.summary: Records the time interval between the last time Enhanced Safe Browsing was enabled and the current disabling event. Logged each time a user disables Enhanced Safe Browsing. Logged at most three times a week. If Enhanced Safe Browsing was enabled more than 30 days go, no metric is logged.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbDisabled.LastSecuritySensitiveEventType
histogram.summary: Records the last security sensitive event type before a user disables Enhanced Safe Browsing. Logged each time a user disables Enhanced Safe Browsing. Logged at most three times a week.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbDisabled.TimesDisabledLast28Days.{EnabledDuration}
histogram.summary: Records the number of times Enhanced Safe Browsing was disabled the last 28 days. Logged each time a user disables ESB. The length of the interval that ESB was enabled is summarized by {EnabledDuration}. The maximum number of times ESB is disabled is tracked is 30, so anything above that is not logged.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbDownloadRowPromo.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of showing an ESB promotion on a download item on the chrome://downloads page. Promotions are only shown on downloads that have been determined to be dangerous and only when the user is able to enable enhanced protection. The histogram outcome is recorded on display and on every click on the promotion.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EsbPromotionFlow.IphShown
histogram.summary: Records the amount of times the In-Product-Help (IPH) bubble is triggered on the Chrome security settings page from one of the three Enhanced Safe Browsing referral/promotion methods.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionPersister.AgedFileFound
histogram.summary: Records if a persisted file is older than 3 days. Every file that is found on disk will have its age checked.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionPersister.CacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of persisted files on disk when the telemetry persister is first initiated. The cache size is only checked when the persister init function is run.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionPersister.PersistedFileSize
histogram.summary: The size of a persisted file in bytes. This is recorded for any file found on disk, regardless of if it was successfully read.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionPersister.ReadResult
histogram.summary: Whether the read request succeeded or not. This is recorded once for every time the persister attempts to read from a file. Read requests happen when the telemetry service successfully uploads a file. If the persister attempts to read from an empty filepath, it will be marked as a failure.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionPersister.WriteResult{Trigger}
histogram.summary: Whether the write request succeeded or not. This is recorded once for every file written{Trigger}. Write requests happen on Chrome shutdown and when an extension telemetry upload is not successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionSafetyHub.Trigger.{Action}
histogram.summary: Extensions that trigger a safety check review are displayed to the user via a panel on the chrome://extensions/ page. These extensions should be reviewed by the user and acknowledged or removed. This metric records when an extension is {Action} in the extension review panel on the chrome://extensions/ page.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.Enterprise.ReportSize
histogram.summary: The size of an enterprise telemetry report. This is recorded once for each send to Chrome Enterprise Reporting server, regardless of whether it was successful. Sending attempts occur periodically (default period is 5 minutes).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.Enterprise.Signals.SignalType
histogram.summary: Records the extension telemetry signal type. Logged each time a signal is triggered (eg. a cookies.get API call is invoked). Applicable only to enterprise.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.CollectionDuration
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram measures how long it takes to collect file data for all the offstore extensions installed. It is emitted after each pass of the collection process completes which occurs periodically (every 2 hours by default). The histogram is not emitted if there are no off-store extensions installed or if the collection process is interrupted due to the browser session ending or disabling Enhanced Safe Browsing for the profile.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.LargestFileSizeObserved
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the largest file size observed while collecting files to process (regardless of whether it exceeds the file size limit). Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.NumFilesFound
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the number of applicable files found in an extension's directories. An applicable file must be non-empty, within the max size limit, and among the applicable types (eg. JS, HTML, CSS). The manifest.json file is also included. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.NumFilesOverProcessingLimit
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the number of files not processed because they exceeded the max files to process per extension limit. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.NumFilesOverSizeLimit
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the number of files not processed because they exceeded the size limit for processing. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed (if applicable).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.NumFilesProcessed
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the number of successfully processed files, including the manifest.json file. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.NumOffstoreExtensions
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the number of off-store extensions installed in a user profile. It is emitted at the start of each pass of the collection process which occurs periodically (every 2 hours by default). The histogram is emitted even if there are no off-store extensions installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.ProcessedFileSize
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records the size of a successfully processed file. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FileData.ValidExtension
histogram.summary: Extension telemetry includes file data such as file hashes for off-store extension files. This histogram records true for a valid extension, and false if the extension root directory or manifest.json file is invalid. Logged by the FileProcessor at periodic intervals (default: once per day) for each off-store extension installed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.FilePersistedAtWriteInterval
histogram.summary: Records if the extension telemetry service is persisting a report at a write interval. True represents a persist event during a write interval, false represents a persist event during Chrome shutdown. Recorded when the extension telemetry service persists a telemetry report to disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.NetworkRequestResponseCodeOrError
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code or net error from each upload attempt. This is recorded once for each network request made as part of an upload, i.e. if an upload fails the first time, but a retry succeeds, this metric is recorded twice. Upload attempts occur periodically (default period is 1 hour) and there are multiple retries attempted (if necessary) after every upload interval.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.OffstoreExtensionDisabledReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason an off-store extension is disabled. This histogram is emitted when Chrome disables an off-store extension based on a verdict received from the Extension Telemetry Server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.OffstoreExtensionReenabled_PastDisabledReason
histogram.summary: Records the previous blocklist state for an off-store extension when it is re-enabled. This histogram is emitted when Chrome re-enables a previously disabled off-store extension based on a new verdict from the Extension Telemetry Server that un-blocklists the extension.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.RetriesTillUploadSuccess
histogram.summary: Counts how many retries were needed to successfully complete the upload request. This is emitted only for a successful upload. Upload attempts occur periodically (default period is 1 hour) and there are multiple retries attempted (if necessary) after every upload interval.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.Signals.Discarded
histogram.summary: Records discarded extension telemetry signals by type. Logged each time a signal is discarded because it contains invalid data (e.g., invalid extension id). The signal type recorded here only corresponds to a a raw signal that is created externally and passed to extension service. The count for a combined signal (that is created internally and derived from other raw signals) should always be 0 since the internally generated signal data should always be valid.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.Signals.SignalType
histogram.summary: Records the extension telemetry signal type. Logged each time a signal is triggered (eg. a tabs.executeScript API call is invoked). The signal can be a raw signal that is created externally and passed to extension service or a combined signal that is created internally and derived from other raw signals. Applicable only to ESB.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.UploadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload request body. This is recorded once for each upload, regardless of whether it was successful. Upload attempts occur periodically (default period is 1 hour).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.UploadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether the overall upload request succeeded or not. This is recorded once for an upload request, regardless of how many retries were needed to complete the upload. Upload attempts occur periodically (default period is 1 hour) and there are multiple retries attempted (if necessary) after every upload interval.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ExtensionTelemetry.{Result}UploadDuration
SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateResult
histogram.summary:
The result of reading/parsing/accepting a new proto for the FileTypePolices repo of file extensions and their meta data.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateVersion
histogram.summary:
Integer version number citing which version of the proto data chrome just loaded. Latest version is in download_file_types.asciipb.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.FailedUpdateDestinationVersion
histogram.summary: Records the new config version when we fail to update due to the new version being lower than the current version.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.FailedUpdateSourceVersion
histogram.summary: Records the current config version when we fail to update due to the new version being lower than the current version.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleResult
histogram.summary:
The result of reading/parsing/accepting a new proto for the FileTypePolices repo of file extensions and their meta data.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleVersion
histogram.summary:
Integer version number citing which version of the proto data chrome just loaded. Latest version is in download_file_types.asciipb.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetReferringAppInfo.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the duration GetReferringAppInfo. Recorded on downloads in Clank, PG pings, and viewing the Referrer Chain tab of chrome://safe-browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.ApiExceptionStatusCode
histogram.summary: Records the status code from SafeBrowsing API. Only logged if the API throws an ApiException. The code definition can be found in https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/CommonStatusCodes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.CheckDelta.SuccessWithRealTime
histogram.summary:
The microseconds between sending the SafeBrowsing API real time call and receiving the SUCCESS_WITH_REAL_TIME response. The end time is fixed in java code and does not include any thread hops or extra work. Note that this does include task queue time to respond to the IPC (and that queue time is often non-trivial). This is logged each time a SUCCESS_WITH_REAL_TIME response is received from SafeBrowsing API.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.CheckDelta{Protocol}
histogram.summary:
The microseconds between sending the SafeBrowsing API {Protocol} call and receiving the response. The end time is fixed in java code and does not include any thread hops or extra work. Note that this does include task queue time to respond to the IPC (and that queue time is often non-trivial). This is logged each time a response is received from SafeBrowsing API. This histogram is comparable with SB2.RemoteCall.CheckDelta which measures a similar duration for SafetyNet API calls.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.HasUnknownExceptionType
histogram.summary: Records whether the Safe Browsing API throws an unknown exception type. Only logged if the API throws an exception.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.IsAvailable{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records whether the SafeBrowsing API is available. The API can be unavailable if a non-recoverable error was encountered in a previous call. This is logged when a SafeBrowsing API {Protocol} URL check starts.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.JavaValidationResult{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records the result after validating the response from SafeBrowsing API. The result can be invalid if there is a version mismatch bewteen Chrome and GMSCore. This histogram is logged exactly once after a {Protocol} response is received from SafeBrowsing API. If there are multiple invalid values, they will be logged in the following order: lookup result, threat type, threat attribute and response status.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.LookupResult{Protocol}
histogram.summary:
Records the {Protocol} lookup result from SafeBrowsing API. In rare circumstance (e.g. version mismatch), there may be out of range samples in this histogram.
This histogram may be skewed towards success or recoverable failure buckets, because Chrome will not retry after a non-recoverable failure is encountered. Check SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.IsAvailable to see how often that happens.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.ResponseStatus{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records the {Protocol} response status from SafeBrowsing API if the lookup result is successful. In rare circumstance (e.g. version mismatch), there may be out of range samples in this histogram.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.ThreatAttributeCount{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records the length of threat attributes from SafeBrowsing API if the {Protocol} lookup result is successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.ThreatAttribute{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records each threat attribute from SafeBrowsing API if the {Protocol} lookup result is successful. May be logged more than once in one single response when there are multiple threat attributes. In rare circumstance (e.g. version mismatch), there may be out of range samples in this histogram.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GmsSafeBrowsingApi.ThreatType2{Protocol}
histogram.summary: Records the threat type from SafeBrowsing API if the {Protocol} lookup result is successful. In rare circumstance (e.g. version mismatch), there may be out of range samples in this histogram. The second version is introduced because SOCIAL_ENGINEERING is switched from 2 to 5.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HasCookieAtStartup2
histogram.summary: Records whether a Safe Browsing cookie exists at profile startup or when a new profile is created. Recorded for regular or incognito profiles.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HitReport.ThreatType
histogram.summary: Records the threat type that triggered the hit report. Logged when a hit report is sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.AllowlistSizeTooSmall
histogram.summary: Logs whether the size of the high confidence allowlist is too small. It can happen if it is misconfigured on the server-side, or the local file is corrupted on the disk. If too small, the allowlist is considered as unavailable. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have hash-prefix real-time lookups enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.AllStoresAvailable
histogram.summary: Logs whether the local Safe Browsing stores are available. If not, all URLs are marked as safe during the lookup. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have hash-prefix real-time lookups enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.BackoffState
histogram.summary: Logs if the hash-prefix real-time lookup service is currently in backoff state due to previous errors. Logs whenever a hash-prefix real-time request is about to be attempted, which will not go through if the service is in backoff mode.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Cache.FullHashCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of full hashes in the local hash-prefix real-time lookup cache for this profile. Logged each time cleanup of expired entries is performed on the cache, which happens every 30 minutes. The value represents the count before cleanup and includes expired entries.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Cache.HashPrefixCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of hash prefixes in the local hash-prefix real-time lookup cache for this profile. Logged each time cleanup of expired entries is performed on the cache, which happens every 30 minutes. The value represents the count before cleanup and includes expired entries.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.CacheDuration.InitialOnSet
histogram.summary: Logs the cache duration that an item will have for a hash-prefix real-time lookup. Logged when the item is added to the cache.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.CacheDuration.RemainingOnHit
histogram.summary: Logs the remaining cache duration that an item has for a hash-prefix real-time lookup. Logged when there is a cache hit for the item.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Records whether there was a cache hit when a hash prefix was searched for in the local cache for hash-prefix real-time lookups. A cache hit means the prefix was found in the cache (whether or not it has associated full hashes), which allows for that prefix not to be re-requested. This histogram is false in the case of a cache miss for the hash prefix. This is logged for each hash prefix in a lookup when the cache is searched.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.CacheHitAllPrefixes
histogram.summary: Records whether all hash prefixes were found in the hash-prefix real-time lookups local cache. It indicates that as a result of the cache, there was no need to send a request to Safe Browsing servers. This is logged each time a lookup occurs, when the cache is searched.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.CanGetReputationOfUrl
histogram.summary: Records whether Safe Browsing can get the reputation of a URL when a hash-prefix real-time check is needed. Logged when URL is loading and hash-prefix real-time check is enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.FailedNetResultIsFromEarlyOhttpClientDestruct
histogram.summary: Logged when a SafeBrowsing hash-prefix real-time lookup request results in a net error ERR_FAILED. Specifies whether or not the error was caused by the OHTTP client destructing before it completed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.FoundUnmatchedFullHashes
histogram.summary: Records whether the response from the hash-prefix real-time lookup contained any full hashes that did not match the requested hash prefixes. This is logged after the network request for the lookup returns.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.GetCache.Time
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between the start of getting a result from the cache and when the cached item is actually obtained for hash-prefix real-time lookups. This is an indicator of the efficiency of retrieving from the cache.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.HashDatabaseFallbackThreatType{TriggerType}
histogram.summary: Logs the threat type when the hash-prefix real-time lookup falls back to hash-prefix local database lookup. This happens when {TriggerType}.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.HasOhttpKey
histogram.summary: Logs whether hash realtime service can obtain a non empty key from OHTTP key service. The lookup will fail if there is no key. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have hash-prefix real-time lookups enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Ineligible.{IneligibleReason}
histogram.summary: Logs whether hash-prefix real-time lookups are ineligible due to {IneligibleReason}. Logged when a browser URL loader throttle is created. Additionally, logged when creating a SafeBrowsing URL checker on iOS. There may be multiple reasons why the lookups are ineligible, but this reason is one of them.

variant.name: IneligibleForSafeBrowsingState
variant.summary: not having standard protection or enhanced protection

variant.name: IneligibleForSessionOrLocation
variant.summary: the feature being disabled for the session or the location

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.IsLookupServiceFound
histogram.summary: Logs whether the hash-prefix real-time lookup service is found when a hash- prefix real-time check is needed. The lookup service is available if it is not nullptr. Logged when the hash-prefix real-time check is enabled and the URL doesn't match the allowlist.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.LocalMatch.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of checking the URL against the local Safe Browsing high confidence allowlist. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have hash-prefix real-time lookups enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Network.HttpResponseCode.{NetError}
histogram.summary: HTTP response code from a SafeBrowsing hash-prefix real-time lookup when the net error is {NetError}. Logged after a lookup request with that net error finishes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Network.Result.WhenEnteringBackoff
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from SafeBrowsing hash-prefix real-time lookups. Logged when the resource check's lookup request results in entering backoff mode.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Network.Time
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip time it took to perform a Safe Browsing hash-prefix real-time lookup. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Network.Time.{NetError}
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip time it took to perform a Safe Browsing hash-prefix real-time lookup when the net error is {NetError}. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Network.{ResponseSource}Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from SafeBrowsing hash-prefix real-time lookups that are obtained from {ResponseSource}. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server. Not logged if the response is not from {ResponseSource}.

variant.summary: aggregated OHTTP handler callback or direct fetch

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.BackoffState
histogram.summary: Logs if the OHTTP key service is currently in backoff state due to previous errors. Logs whenever a key fetch request is about to be attempted (either triggered by hash prefix lookup, asynchronous workflow or server hint), which will not go through if the service is in backoff mode.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.FetchKeyTriggerReason
histogram.summary: Logs how the key fetch is triggered. Logs whenever a key fetch request is about to be attempted (either triggered by hash prefix lookup, asynchronous workflow or server hint), which will not go through if the service is in backoff mode.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.FirstLookupResponseCodeFromCurrentKey
histogram.summary: HTTP response code from the first SafeBrowsing hash-prefix real-time lookup using the current ohttp key. Logged only for the first response after a new ohttp key is fetched. This histogram helps us understand how often a new key fails to work. Not logged if this is the first request using the key that is retrieved from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.HasCachedKey
histogram.summary: Logs whether OHTTP key service has a valid key cached in memory. Logged each time a key is requested through the get OHTTP key API.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.IsEnabledFreshnessOnKeyFetch
histogram.summary: Logs whether the OHTTP key service is up to date in whether or not it is enabled. Logged each time a key is requested through the get OHTTP key API.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.IsFasterOhttpKeyRotationEnabled
histogram.summary: Logs whether faster OHTTP key rotation is enabled. Logged each time OHTTP key service is enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.Network.Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from OHTTP key hosting endpoint. Logged on each key fetch request that is sent to the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OhttpKeyService.Network.Time
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip time it took to fetch a new OHTTP key. Logged on each key fetch request that is sent to the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the return status for hash-prefix real-time lookups. This is logged when the service is returning a response, which can be: if the result is found in the local cache, if the lookup doesn't run because the service is in backoff mode, if the lookup doesn't run because the OHTTP key can't be fetched, or after the lookup network request returns.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.Request.CountOfPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of prefixes included in a hash-prefix real-time lookup request sent to the Google Safe Browsing servers. This excludes any prefixes found in the local cache.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.HPRT.ThreatInfoSize{SourceDetails}

variant.summary: Logged each time a lookup request completes without errors or when the request does not need to be sent because all the results are in the local cache.

variant.name: .LocalCache
variant.summary: Logged each time a lookup request does not need to be sent because all the results are in the local cache.

variant.name: .NetworkRequest
variant.summary: Logged each time a lookup request completes without errors.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.IOS.IsCheckCompletedOnShouldAllowResponse
histogram.summary: Logs whether the Safe Browsing check is completed when a navigation response has arrived. If not, the navigation will be deferred until the Safe Browsing check is completed. Logs on each navigation response policy callback.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.IOS.RepeatedResponseCalled
histogram.summary: Logs whether a subsequent Safe Browsing navigation response without a matching call to ShouldAllowRequest was called. Logs on each subsequent navigation response policy callback.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.IOS.TotalDelay
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between when a navigation response policy decision was deferred by Safe Browsing check and when the check is completed. Logs each time that a navigation was deferred by Safe Browsing check and the Safe Browsing check doesn't block the URL.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.IOS.TotalDelay2{UserCategory}
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between when a navigation response policy decision was deferred by a Safe Browsing check and when the check is completed, for a {UserCategory} URL check request. This metric is different from SafeBrowsing.IOS.TotalDelay as it logs for each request, including those not deferred and those that are blocked, recording zero delay when the request is not deferred.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.LocalBinaryUploadRequest.DlpResult
histogram.summary: This records whether local DLP scanning succeeded or not. It is logged once for each binary upload with DLP scanning enabled (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.LocalBinaryUploadRequest.Duration
histogram.summary: This records the duration of each binary upload request. It is logged once for each binary upload (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.LocalBinaryUploadRequest.Result
histogram.summary: This records whether DLP scanning succeeded or not. It is logged once for each binary upload with DLP scanning enabled (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationIdMatchedInUnsafeResource
histogram.summary: Logs whether the navigation id of the current navigation matches the one that is stored in unsafe resources. A warning will likely be shown if the value is true. Logged when PopUnsafeResourceForNavigation is called and the URL already matches. This histogram will help us understand how many warnings are skipped because the navigation id doesn't match.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.NotificationNavigationEventAdded
histogram.summary: Logs the number of times we have added Push notification-intiated navigation events.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.NotificationOriginAddedToReferrerChain
histogram.summary: Logs the number of times a notification's service worker's URL is added as a referrer in a referrer chain.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.RedirectForTelScheme
histogram.summary: Logs how many times users are redirected for tel URL. This serves as an estimate how often users are (unknowingly) being redirected to possibly different phone numbers.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationThrottle.IsSameURL
histogram.summary: Records whether the URL being navigated to is the same as the URL flagged by Safe Browsing. They can be different if a server redirect is encountered. Logged each time a pre-commit Safe Browsing error page is about to show. If the URL is not the same, the URL displayed in the URL bar will be incorrect.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NotificationContentDetection.AllowlistCheckLatency
histogram.summary: Records the latency of performing an allowlist check that happens before (possibly) performing inference on the notification content detection model. Logged when there is a request to display a persisitent notification.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NotificationContentDetection.SuspiciousScore
histogram.summary: Records the suspicious label's score (or probability) from the notification content detection LiteRT model for some notification contents. Logged each time model inference is performed on the notification content model (for non-allowlisted sites only).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PageLoadToken.ClearReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that page load tokens are cleared. Logged each time tokens are cleared.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PageLoadToken.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the duration between a token is created and a token is retrieved. Logged each time GetPageLoadToken is called and the token is found in the token map.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PageLoadToken.HasExpired
histogram.summary: Records whether a page load token has expired when it is retrieved. Logged each time GetPageLoadToken is called and the token is found in the token map.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PageLoadToken.PasswordProtectionHasToken
histogram.summary: Records whether a page load token is found before password protection request is sent. Logged only when real time URL check is enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PageLoadToken.TokenCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of page load tokens stored in verdict cache manager. Logged each time after a periodic clean up on expired tokens is performed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PakIntegrity.{PakFile}
histogram.summary: Reports whether the {PakFile} file's SHA-256 hash matches the digest produced at build-time. This detects on-disk corruption of the .pak file. Recorded at startup on Linux, Mac, and Windows.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.PhishySite.{UserEvent}
histogram.summary: Records the number of times a user {UserEvent} a site that was flagged as phishy by safe browsing. Logged after 5 minutes of inactivity or when the user leaves the page.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Daily.Extended
histogram.summary: Whether the Safe Browsing extended reporting service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Daily.PasswordLeakToggle
histogram.summary: Records the current state of the password leak toggle under standard protection on the chrome://settings/security page. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Daily.SafeBrowsingModeManaged
histogram.summary: Whether the Safe Browsing mode is managed by the user's admin. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles every 24 hours and at startup if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Daily.SafeBrowsingState
histogram.summary: The current Safe Browsing state of the profile. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was more than 24 hours ago.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Enhanced
histogram.summary:
Whether the Safe Browsing enhanced protection service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Enhanced.RegularProfile
histogram.summary: Whether the Safe Browsing enhanced protection service is currently enabled. Recorded for non-Incognito user profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Extended
histogram.summary:
Whether the Safe Browsing extended reporting service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.General
histogram.summary:
Whether the Safe Browsing service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.MainProfile.SafeBrowsingState
histogram.summary: The current Safe Browsing state of the main profile. Recorded for all uma log at upload time by the SafeBrowsingMetricsProvider for the main profile only.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ReferrerAttributionResult
histogram.summary: The result of referrer attribution, including different types of success or failure. This is incremented each time a safe browsing ping or download ping is generated.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ReferrerURLChainSize
histogram.summary: The length of referrer URL chain we get from referrer attribution. This is logged each time a safe browsing ping or download ping is generated.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RendererThrottle.IsCheckCompletedOnProcessResponse
histogram.summary: Logs whether the Safe Browsing check is completed when the renderer URL loader starts to process a response. If not, the renderer URL loader will be deferred until the Safe Browsing check is completed. Logs each time the renderer URL loader dispatches WillProcessResponse() and the Safe Browsing check doesn't block the URL.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RendererThrottle.RequestDestination
histogram.summary: Logs the request destination of the URL that is checked by the renderer URL loader throttle, and whether the URL check was requested. Logged each time WillStartRequest is called.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.AllowlistSizeTooSmall
histogram.summary:
Logs whether the size of the high confidence allowlist is too small. It can happen if it is misconfigured on the server-side, or the local file is corrupted on the disk. If too small, the allowlist is considered as unavailable. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have the real time URL lookups enabled.
In M125 and M126, this contained logs from the full-screen use case of the allowlist as well.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.AllStoresAvailable
histogram.summary:
Logs whether the local Safe Browsing stores are available. If not, all URLs are marked as safe during real time URL lookup. Logged each time a top frame URL navigation happens for users who have the real time URL lookups enabled.
In M125 and M126, this contained logs from the full-screen use case of the allowlist as well.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.BackoffState{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs if the real time URL lookup service is currently in backoff state due to previous errors. Logs whenever a real time URL request is about to be attempted, which will not go through if the service is in backoff mode.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.CacheManager.CleanUpTime
histogram.summary: Logs the time it takes to run a cleanup task in cache manager. Logged each time a cleanup task is run.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.CacheManager.RealTimeVerdictCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of real time URL verdicts stored for this profile. Logged each time a new real time url verdict is cached.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.CanCheckDatabase
histogram.summary: Logs whether Safe Browsing database can be checked in Safe Browsing URL checker. Logged each time a URL is checked by Safe Browsing URL checker.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.ConsumerVersionReason
histogram.summary: Logs the reason why a consumer version is preferred over the enterprise version for the RealTime URL Lookup service. Logged on all platforms with RealTime URL Lookup service, and logged whenever a URL is checked by Safe Browsing URL checker. May even be logged multiple times per URL check, depending on how many times the function is called.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.EventUrlReferrerChainFetchSucceeded{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logged when fetching the referrer chain for a pending event URL is not able to find a matching navigation event, so the referrer chain is fetched for non-pending event URLs instead as a fallback. Logs true if the fallback fetch returns a non-empty chain.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.GetCache.FallbackThreatType
histogram.summary: Logs the threat type of cached verdicts. If the threat type is not safe, it means the cache is a false positive. False positive verdicts are safe verdicts in cache manager but turns out to be dangerous in the Safe Browsing database. Logged each time a URL is checked by real time URL lookup and the response is safe from the cache manager.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.GetCache.Time{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the latency between the start of getting a result from the cache and when the cache is actually obtained. The time includes bouncing between IO and UI threads. This is an indicator of the efficiency of loading the cache.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.GetCacheResult{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the result of real time URL cache lookup. If the result is VERDICT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED, that means cache miss and a ping will be sent afterwards. Otherwise, ping won't be sent. This is an indicator of cache hit rate.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.GetToken.Time
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between the start of a token request and when the token is actually obtained. Logged each time a user performs a real-time Safe Browsing URL check with token.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.HashDatabaseFallbackThreatType{TriggerType}
histogram.summary: Logs the threat type when the URL real-time lookup falls back to hash-prefix local database lookup. This happens when {TriggerType}.

variant.name: .CacheMatch
variant.summary: the URL matches the local cache

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.HasTokenFromFetcher
histogram.summary: Logs whether a token received from the token fetcher is nonempty. Logged each time a response is received from the token fetcher. It shows the validity of the tokens received from the token fetcher.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.HasTokenInRequest{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs whether a token is attached when a URL lookup request is sent. Logged each time a URL lookup request is sent. It shows the percentage of URL lookup requests that are attached with tokens.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.IsLookupServiceFound
histogram.summary: Logs whether the real time URL lookup service is found when a real time URL check is needed. The real time URL lookup service is available if it is not nullptr. Logged when real time URL check is enabled and the URL doesn't match the allowlist.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.IsLookupSuccessful.{ReportType}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the response of the real time URL lookup is successful when the report type is {ReportType}. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server. A failure can be either a network error or a parsing error.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.IsLookupSuccessful{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs whether the response of the real time URL lookup is successful. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server. A failure can be either a network error or a parsing error.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result{UserCategory}
SafeBrowsing.RT.Network.Result.{ReportType}
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from SafeBrowsing real time URL lookups when the report type is {ReportType}. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Network.Result{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Response or error codes from SafeBrowsing real time URL lookups. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server. Starting M92, the ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE net error is matched to the actual HTTP response code.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Network.Time{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the roundtrip time it took to perform a Safe Browsing real time URL lookup. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.Concurrent{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs whether a real-time lookup service request is concurrent with an existing request for the same sanitized URL. Concurrent requests are batched together so that only one network request is made to the backend lookup service.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.HadCookie.{RequestType}{UserType}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the Safe Browsing real time request had a cookie, recorded for {RequestType} upon completion of the URL request. Logged for {UserType}.

variant.name: FirstRequest
variant.summary: the first request after service startup

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.ReferrerChainLength{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the length of the referrer chain in a real time URL check request. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.Size{UserCategory}
SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.UserPopulation{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the user population that was checked by Safe Browsing real time URL lookup. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Response.VerdictType.{UserPopulation}
histogram.summary: Logs the verdict type of the response from real time URL check from an {UserPopulation} user. This histogram tells us whether EnhancedProtection users are more likely to get dangerous verdicts as well as the average number of Protego pings for EnhancedProtection users and non-EnhancedProtection users.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.Response.VerdictType{UserCategory}
SafeBrowsing.RT.SampledRequestSent
histogram.summary: Logs the type of the real time URL check requests. It could be a sampled report request that only happens 1% of the time when URLs match the Protego allowlist, or a full report request otherwise when an real time URL request is sent.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.RT.ThreatInfoSize{UserCategory}
histogram.summary:
Logs the number of verdicts received in the real time URL check response. Logged on each resource check for which a lookup request is sent to the server.
{UserCategory}

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Settings.UserAction.{AccessPoint}
histogram.summary: Logs the user action performed on the Safe Browsing settings page. Depending on the enum value, logged when the page is showned to the user or when the user performs an action on the page.

variant.name: Default
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from a default access point.

variant.name: ParentSettings
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from the parent setting page.

variant.name: SafetyCheck
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from the SafetyCheck page.

variant.name: SecurityInterstitial
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from the security interstitial.

variant.name: SurfaceExplorerPromoSlinger
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from the Surface Explorer page.

variant.name: TailoredSecurity
variant.summary: The user enters the Safe Browsing settings page from the UX shown due to a change in the Tailored Security setting

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityHeuristic
histogram.summary: Logged after each non-incognito page navigation. Logs the matching user-familiarity heuristics for the site. If the site satisifies multiple heuristics the metric will be logged multiple times. NO_HEURISTIC_MATCH is logged if no user-familiarity heuristics match for the site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityHeuristic.Engagement15OrVisitedBeforeTodayOrHighConfidence
histogram.summary: Logged after each non-off-the-record page navigation. Logs whether the site matches a heuristic which requires - The page to be on the safe browsing high confidence allowlist OR - The page to have been visited more than 24 hours ago OR - The page to have a site engagement score of > 15

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityHeuristic.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Logged after each off-the-record page navigation. Logs the matching user-familiarity heuristics for the site. If the site satisifies multiple heuristics the metric will be logged multiple times. NO_HEURISTIC_MATCH is logged if no user-familiarity heuristics match for the site.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityMetricDataFetchDuration
histogram.summary: Logged when SiteProtectionMetricsObserver has finished asynchronously fetching data from local databases in order to compute the user-familiarity for a given website. The computation occurs after each non-off-the-record page navigation. Logs the duration of fetching the data and doing the computation.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityMetricDataFetchDuration.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Logged when SiteProtectionMetricsObserver has finished asynchronously fetching data from local databases in order to compute the user-familiarity for a given website. The computation occurs after each off-the-record page navigation. Logs the duration of fetching the data and doing the computation.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.SiteProtection.FamiliarityMetricDataFetchStart
histogram.summary: Logged as a result of a page navigation when SiteProtectionMetricsObserver starts fetching data.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurity.ConsentedDesktopDialogDisabledOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of displaying the Chrome enhanced protection opt-in/disabled dialog to sync users. It is logged once each time Chrome is informed that the account level enhanced protection bit has been disabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurity.ConsentedDesktopDialogEnabledOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of displaying the Chrome enhanced protection opt-in/enabled dialog to sync users. It is logged once each time Chrome is informed that the account level enhanced protection bit has been enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurity.IsRecoveryTriggered
histogram.summary: Records whether the observer-based retry mechanism for the ChromeTailoredSecurityService has been triggered or not which is logged on every update to the synced account ESB timestamp.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurity.ShouldRetryOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of running the tailored security retry logic. It is logged once each time Chrome starts for syncing users in the cases where the retry attempt could occur.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurity.SyncPromptEnabledNotificationResult2
histogram.summary: Records the result of trying to show the Chrome enhanced protection opt-in/enabled notification to sync users. It is logged once each time Chrome is informed that the account level enhanced protection bit has been enabled.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityConsented{Status}{PromptType}Outcome
histogram.summary:
Logs the outcome of displaying the {PromptType} when a signed-in, syncing user changes their account tailored security setting to {Status}.
Notification prompts were removed in M113 along with the corresponding UX.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityService.OAuthTokenCompletion
histogram.summary: Safe Browsing needs a token in order to make a request to get the tailored security service bit. This histogram tracks whether getting a token is successful or not.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityService.OAuthTokenErrorState
histogram.summary: Safe Browsing needs a token in order to make a request to get the tailored security service bit. This histogram tracks the HTTP code when getting a token is not successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityService.OAuthTokenResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP Response code returned by the server when trying to fetch the OAuth token for a tailored security service query.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityUnconsentedModalOutcome
histogram.summary: Logs the outcome of displaying a modal dialog on Desktop when a signed-in, non-syncing user changes their account tailored security setting in the flow of consenting.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityUnconsentedPromotionNotificationOutcome
histogram.summary: Logs the outcome of displaying a notification on desktop when a signed-in, non-syncing user changes their account tailored security setting not in the flow of consenting.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TailoredSecurityUnconsented{Flow}MessageOutcome
histogram.summary: Logs the outcome of displaying the message on Android when a signed-in, non-syncing user changes their account tailored security setting and is {Flow} of consenting.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.TokenFetcher.ErrorType
histogram.summary: Logs the error type from the token fetcher. Logs each time safe browsing gets a response from the token fetcher. When the error type is none, it means the token is obtained successfully.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Triggers.AdSampler.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks the actions taken by the Ad Sampling trigger whenever it is executed. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-07-01 to 2021-10-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Triggers.SuspiciousSite.DelayTimerState
SafeBrowsing.Triggers.SuspiciousSite.Event
histogram.summary: Tracks the events occurring in the Suspicious Site trigger whenever it is executed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Triggers.SuspiciousSite.ReportRejectionReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reasons that a report requested by the Suspicious Site trigger is rejected by the Trigger Manager. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-11-07 to 2023-11-28; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.URTAndBackgroundHPRT.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the the URL lookup verdicts from URL real-time lookups and the background HPRT lookups.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Database.Size
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database or file on disk in kilobytes, after reading it from disk on startup and after a database update has occurred.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Database.SizeLinear{ThreatTypeKB}
histogram.summary: The size of {ThreatTypeKB} SafeBrowsing database or file on disk in 100 KB, after reading it from disk on startup and after a database update has occurred. Linear version of V4Database.Size histogram.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Database.SizeLinear{ThreatType}
histogram.summary: The size of {ThreatType} SafeBrowsing database or file on disk in megabytes, after reading it from disk on startup and after a database update has occurred. Linear version of V4Database.Size histogram.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Database.UpdateLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of updating the SafeBrowsing database. This measures the time difference between calls to update the SafeBrowsing V4 database. This gets logged after every call for an update to the database, except for the first one. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-03-04 to 2024-04-17; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DatabaseInitializationTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to create the V4 database. Logged on each startup, when the database is created.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.CacheFullyHit
histogram.summary: Track whether a V4 request was able to be skipped because all parts of it were found in the local cache. Logged after the V4 local cache is checked.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.CacheHit.Result
histogram.summary: Track cache hits for V4 full hashes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Check.Result
histogram.summary: Track get hash response hits for V4 full hash requests.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.CountOfPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of prefixes included in a full hash request sent to the Google Safe Browsing servers. This is recorded each time there's a match found in the local database and requires sending a full hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Network.Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing Pver4 service. Logged after a GetHash or request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call. Warning: this histogram was expired from M86 to M91. Data may be missing. Starting M92, the ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE net error is matched to the actual HTTP response code.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Network.Time
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a full hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Parse.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Result
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 GetHash attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Result.BackoffErrorCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of GetHash attempts skipped (due to being in backoff) within the same backoff time window. Logged if there are any backoff errors at the time of backoff window expiry.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4LocalDatabaseManager.ThreatInfoSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of verdicts received in the full hash check. Logged each time a full hash check response is received.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4LocalDatabaseManager.TimeSinceLastUpdateResponse
histogram.summary: Records the time since the last network response was received for a request to udpate the Safe Browsing local database. This will be logged whenever the database is queried, but only if at least one such network response has been received since the browser was launched.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.AdditionsHashesCount2
histogram.summary: Records the number of additions hashes in a SafeBrowsing list full update. This was added in M92 to accomodate a larger maximum size.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying a full update for a store received from PVer4 SafeBrowsing service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.ApplyUpdateDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to perform a full update of a V4 store. This is recorded in thread time, to avoid recording any disk operations.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions. This histogram is specific to processing full updates received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.RemovalsHashesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of removals hashes in a SafeBrowsing list full update.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.AdditionsHashesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of additions hashes in a SafeBrowsing list partial update.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying a partial update for a store received from PVer4 SafeBrowsing service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.ApplyUpdateDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to perform a partial update of a V4 store. This is recorded in thread time, to avoid recording any disk operations.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions. This histogram is specific to processing partial updates received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of indexes of hash prefixes to remove since the last update. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded removals.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.RemovalsHashesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of removals hashes in a SafeBrowsing list partial update.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying an ListUpdateResponse read from disk after parsing it successfully as a protobuf.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per Chrome launch. It is specific to processing V4StoreFileFormat proto read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.VerifyChecksumDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to verify the checksum of a V4 store. This is recorded in thread time, to avoid recording any disk operations.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Store.IsStoreValid
histogram.summary: Records whether a store has valid data, when it is queried. This is logged once for every 256 times (a heuristic applied starting M104 for making recording more efficient) a store is checked (a few times for each download, and once when a potentially dangerous subresource is loaded).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Store.ReadyOnStartup
histogram.summary: Logs whether an individual store has valid data immediately after being constructed. This is logged once for each V4 store on each startup. Failures here can indicate an inability to read data from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreRead.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of reading the SafeBrowsing V4 store file from disk. Recorded every time a store is read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreWrite.Result
histogram.summary: Track the results of writing the SafeBrowsing V4 store file to disk. Recorded every time a store is written to disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Network.Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes when fetching updates from the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service. Starting M92, the ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE net error is matched to the actual HTTP response code.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Parse.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Update request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.ResponseSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size of the response sent by the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service, in KB.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Result
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 update attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WarningBypassAllowlist.SchemeOnWrite
histogram.summary: Records the scheme of the URL used when writing to the warning bypass allowlist.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebView.AppOptIn
histogram.summary:
Records whether the application has explicitly opted in or out of Safe Browsing by manifest tag, or if they're relying on the default behavior. This is recorded once during startup.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-06-06 to 2024-07-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebView.UserOptInKnown.EveryLoad
histogram.summary: Records whether user consent for Safe Browsing is known or if we are still waiting for a callback to return. A value of "true" means the consent is known (but not necessarily whether the consent is positive or negative), and a value of "false" means we are still waiting for a result callback. This histogram is recorded during every URL load when we check the Safe Browsing opt-in status.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebView.UserOptInKnown.FirstLoad
histogram.summary: Records whether user consent for Safe Browsing is known or if we are still waiting for a callback to return. A value of "true" means the consent is known (but not necessarily whether the consent is positive or negative), and a value of "false" means we are still waiting for a result callback. This histogram is recorded exactly once, during the first URL load in WebView.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.{CloudOrLocal}DeepScan.{Connector}.BytesPerSeconds
SafeBrowsing.{CloudOrLocal}DeepScan.{Connector}{Result}.Duration
SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.DlpResult
histogram.summary: This records whether DLP scanning succeeded or not. It is logged once for each binary upload with DLP scanning enabled (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.Duration
histogram.summary: This records the duration of each binary upload request. It is logged once for each binary upload (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.MalwareResult
histogram.summary: This records whether the malware deep scanning succeeded or not. It is logged once for each binary upload with malware scanning enabled (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.Result
histogram.summary: This records the outcome of each binary upload request. It is logged once for each binary upload (file download or upload with the appropriate enterprise policies enabled).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.TimeToGetFCMToken
histogram.summary: This records how long it took for the request to get the FCM token. It is logged every time a deep scanning request successfully gets a token.
